required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Survey of Women's Choice of Delivery Before Consulting With Her Obstetrician
clinical_study.official_title: Understanding a Woman's Choice of Mode of Delivery Before Initial Consult With Her Obstetrician After Having One Prior Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: We are surveying women who have had a previous cesarean section at the time of entry into prenatal care for their next pregnancy about their thoughts related to a trial of labor after cesarean (TOLAC) or repeat c-section.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a survey for women who have had a previous cesarean section, also known as a c-section, with their last pregnancy. The study is looking at what factors and people may influence the decisions women make about their birthing plan after they have had a previous c-section. If they qualify, women will be asked to complete a brief survey at their initial Ob/Gyn appointment before they see their Ob doctor. In order to qualify, women must:
- Be pregnant
- Have not seen an obstetrician for this pregnancy
- Be at least 18 years old
- Be able to read English
- Have had a prior pregnancy delivered by c-section
- Only had one prior c-section
- The c-section must have been the last pregnancy before this one
Questions that will be asked include:
- Demographic information (examples: age, race/ethnicity)
- Pregnancy information
- Delivery questions
- Factors that may influence her birthing plan
Participants will also be asked if the study staff can follow up after her delivery to see what kind of delivery she had (vaginal or c-section).

primary_outcome.measure: Participant Opinions of mode of delivery as compared to actual mode of delivery
primary_outcome.time_frame: Mode of delivery will be assessed after delivery, average 40 weeks gestational age (7-9 months after enrollment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors that influence participant's opinion of mode of delivery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected at time of study enrollment, typically 4-12 weeks into the subject's pregnancy.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked what influences their opinions of mode of delivery, such as significant other, clinicians, family, friends, or others. They will also be asked how much these factors may influence their decisions (high influence, some influence, no influence).

other_outcome.time_frame: Collected at study enrollment, typically 4-12 weeks into the subject's pregnancy.
other_outcome.description: Participants will be asked if they trust the information that they receive from influencing factors, such as significant others, clinicians, family, friends, or other.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women with a prior cesarean section
arm_group.description: Survey of women who had a cesarean section with their last pregnancy and no other prior cesarean section deliveries

intervention.arm_group_label: Women with a prior cesarean section

study_pop.textblock: Participants will be selected from the new obstetrics patients in the University of California, Davis Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology department clinics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant Women
- 18 years old or older
- Prior pregnancy with cesarean delivery
- No prior obstetric physician care during current pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- More than one prior cesarean
- Women who cannot read English

facility.name: University of California, Davis Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
